com.yantra.api.ydm

Interface addToContainer

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    com.yantra.api.YDMApi, YIFApi

    public interface addToContainer

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      org.w3c.dom.Document addToContainer(YFSEnvironment env, org.w3c.dom.Document inXML)
      The addToContainer API is used to add SKU to a Container or a Container into another Container or converting an Inventory LPN to a Container.

    • Method Detail

      • addToContainer

        org.w3c.dom.Document addToContainer(YFSEnvironment env,
                                    org.w3c.dom.Document inXML)
                             throws com.yantra.yfs.japi.YFSException,
                                    java.rmi.RemoteException

        The addToContainer API is used to add SKU to a Container or a Container into another Container or converting an Inventory LPN to a Container. The addToContainer API creates the Container if it does not exist. When a container is added to a parent container, the child container is moved to the Bin location given by the Pack reason code and this bin location should not track the LPN. This is also used to capture inner pack information for containers, while adding SKU to a container. If open pick tasks exist for the container/shipment, those tasks are completed at pack station while calling this api. Only those tasks which are not performed using mobile device are considered for completion. Tasks are completed only for the SKU which is getting added in the current transaction. Task will be auto completed only when source location has loose SKU inventory. If the source location has only LPN inventory, task will not get auto completed. When packing of shipment is complete, all remaining pick tasks for the shipment is canceled.

        The transaction for creating a container is provided in the factorysetup. The Transaction ID is CREATE_CONTAINER.

        The transaction for adding to a container is provided in the factorysetup. The Transaction ID is ADD_TO_CONTAINER.



        If the OrganizationCode to which the container belongs, has TaskType PACK associated to it and AddingComplete for the container is 'Y', then task will be created and completed in order to track productivity in the node.

        If the pack process of the Shipment is getting completed as part of this transaction, then all the planned tasks for the Shipment which are planned for Expected Pick Date is marked complete.

        If a container belongs to shipment going to break bulk node, then the container gets auto-manifested on container pack process complete if the shipment requires package level integration. If the shipment requires shipment level integration, then all the containers of the shipment get auto-manifested on shipment pack process complete.

        Related Documents
        Input XML Input DTD Output XML Output DTD Error XML Error DTD

        User Exits:
        com.yantra.ydm.japi.ue.YDMBeforeAddToContainerUE.
        com.yantra.ydm.japi.ue.YDMCanAddToContainerUE.
        com.yantra.ydm.japi.ue.YDMCanShipmentBeProcessedUE.
        com.yantra.yfs.japi.ue.YFSGetOverriddenOveragePercentageUE.
        com.yantra.ycp.japi.ue.YCPDetermineTaskTypeUE.
        The following user exit is called for container weight re-computation when packing is complete for the container:
        com.yantra.ydm.japi.ue.YDMGetOverridenAttributesForShipmentLineItemUE

        Events Raised:
        Event raised under the transaction CREATE_CONTAINER

          ON_SUCCESS This event is raised for the container if it is created.
          Data published - YDM_CREATE_CONTAINER.ON_SUCCESS.xml

        Event raised under the transaction ADD_TO_CONTAINER
          ON_SUCCESS This event is raised for the container on successful completion of the API.
          Data published - YDM_ADD_TO_CONTAINER.ON_SUCCESS.xml

          ON_CONTAINER_PACK_COMPLETE This event is raised for the container when it goes into Packed Status.
          Data published - YDM_ADD_TO_CONTAINER.ON_CONTAINER_PACK_COMPLETE.xml

          ON_CONTAINER_PACK_PROCESS_COMPLETE This event is raised for the container when its pack process is complete i.e. there are no more pending activities on it.
          Data published - YDM_ADD_TO_CONTAINER.ON_CONTAINER_PACK_PROCESS_COMPLETE.xml

          ON_SHIPMENT_PACK_COMPLETE This event is raised for the container's Shipment when the Shipment's PlacedQuantity equals TotalQuantity.
          Data published - YDM_ADD_TO_CONTAINER.ON_SHIPMENT_PACK_COMPLETE.xml

          ON_SHIPMENT_PACK_PROCESS_COMPLETE This event is raised for the container 's Shipment when all the Shipment's Containers' pack process is complete.
          Data published - YDM_ADD_TO_CONTAINER.ON_SHIPMENT_PACK_PROCESS_COMPLETE.xml

        Key data - container_dbd.txt

        Template Support Yes

        Audits: None

        Pre-conditions: None

        Post-conditions: None

        Output Template Support: Yes

        Database Extensibility Support: Yes


Parameters:
env - Required. Environment handle returned by the createEnvironment API.
inXML - Required. For more information, see the associated input xml files.

Returns:
An XML document that contains details of the container. For details on the output, refer to the associated output files.

Throws:
com.yantra.yfs.japi.YFSException - Exception containing error codes in the standard error files.
java.rmi.RemoteException - Java's default remote exception handler.
